text: ਰਾਗੁ ਗੋਂਡ ਬਾਣੀ ਰਵਿਦਾਸ ਜੀਉ ਕੀ ਘਰੁ ੨
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Gond, The Word Of Ravi Daas Jee, Second House:

transliteration.text: rāg gōnhd bānī ravidās jīu kī ghar 2

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditate on the Lord Mukanday, the Liberator, O people of the world.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Without Mukanday, the body shall be reduced to ashes.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

author.author: Saint Ravidas
author.description: Saint Ravidas [1377 - 1528] was a Hindu shoemaker of the Chamar caste, who taught that a person is distinguished not by their caste, wealth or social status but instead by their actions.  Meerabai, the famous saint poetess is also said to have adopted Saint Ravidas as her Guru.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Mukanday is the Giver of liberation.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Mukanday is my father and mother. ||1||

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditate on Mukanday in life, and meditate on Mukanday in death.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

text: ਤਾ ਕੇ ਸੇਵਕ ਕਉ ਸਦਾ ਅਨੰਦੇ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: His servant is blissful forever. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: tā kē sēvak kau sadā anandē .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The Lord, Mukanday, is my breath of life.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Meditating on Mukanday, one's forehead will bear the Lord's insignia of approval.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The renunciate serves Mukanday.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Mukanday is the wealth of the poor and forlorn. ||2||

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: When the One Liberator does me a favor,

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: then what can the world do to me?

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Erasing my social status, I have entered His Court.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You, Mukanday, are potent throughout the four ages. ||3||

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Spiritual wisdom has welled up, and I have been enlightened.

melody.description: Gond is an expression of triumph, however these feelings are balanced and in perspective ensuring that there is also an aspect of humility. Therefore, although there is a sense of knowing and understanding the achievement, there is not a feeling of becoming obsessed or getting lost in the achievement itself.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: In His Mercy, the Lord has made this worm His slave.

section: Gond - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Ravi Daas, now my thirst is quenched;

translation.text: I meditate on Mukanday the Liberator, and I serve Him. ||4||1||
